page.title: 12Mawthorpe Bygones Museum
page.content: The 'Mawthorpe Bygones' is situated in Mawthorpe and is run by a local removal contractor and his wife. They also have a fairground organ and an old steam engine which generates the electricity for this. The collection covers 3 acres and includes 4 sheds, containing some of the several thousand articles they have acquired since 1955. At this time people were moving from rural to urban areas and were leaving bottles and jars behind which the owners begged. Now people donate old articles or, as he has a removal firm, he sees many old articles and has a chance to buy them. His oldest article is an ox's shoe last used pre 1850. The owners find that most of the interest in the musuem comes from other counties, as local people do not realise the variety of his collection.
